items.title: Short Call: Passenger vehicles in driving seat as two-wheelers hit the brakes; Signature Global, Eicher Motors in focus
items.description: “The stock market is a device to transfer money from the impatient to the patient," - Warren Buffett

items.title: Live: Can Nifty extend gains to 24,800? | DMart, Bank of Maharashtra in focus | Opening Bell
items.description: Bulls were back roaring last session, sending benchmark indices Sensex up by 1,400 points while Nifty surged nearly 500 points, breaking well past its 200-DMA. Majority of the support came in from auto, IT, and financial stocks, whereas broader indices underperformed. Over the next few days, investors will closely track Q3 business updates from companies as we step into the earnings season. Experts are eyeing Nifty's resistance at 24,200, with support placed around 24,900. This morning, global cues were mixed. US markets ended lower on the first day of 2025. Meanwhile, Asia-Pacific markets traded higher. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Avenue Supermarts, Bank of Maharashtra, and NHPC. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader & Trading Influencer and Vinit Bolinjka, Head of Research, Ventura Securities

items.title: Pricol shares in focus on divestment of wiping business division
items.description: Pricol Share Price | The company board at their meeting held on January 2 approved divestment of wiping business division to Auto Ignition on a slump sale basis through execution of business transfer agreement. The consideration for the proposed transaction is Rs 20 crores, subject to adjustments set out in the business transfer agreement.

items.title: RITES shares in focus on order win worth Rs 69.78 crore from SAIL
items.description: RITES Share Price | The company's subsidiary REMC signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) to explore options for financing power projects for supply to the railways.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a weak start for the day. Wall Street see-sawed to a lower close on Thursday amid choppy trading, as investors embarked on the new year facing the cross-currents of solid labor market data, a rising dollar and tumbling Tesla shares.

items.title: Sensex slips nearly 400 pts, Nifty below 24,200 as IT, bank stocks fall; broader market outperforms
items.description: The small and midcap indices continued to showcase robust trends following broad-based buying. While the midcap index traded 0.4 percent higher, the smallcap index traded 0.6 percent in the green.

items.title: Wockhardt shares rally 5% after Indian drug regulator approves Pneumonia antibiotic
items.description: Central Drugs Standard Control Organization (CDSCO) approved antibiotic Nafithromycin, sold under Miqnaf brand, as a new treatment for community-acquired bacterial Pneumonia (CABP) in adults.

items.title: Stocks to Watch: Bharti Airtel, Varun Beverages, IRFC, NHPC & Biocon
Agri Picks Report January 03 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Arrivals of the new kharif tur crop in spot markets across the country rose 78% on year in December, to 84,130.33 tonnes from 47,154.63 tonnes in December 2023, according to the India Pulses and Grains Association.

items.title: ONGC promises upside, says Jefferies; Oil India higher as crude goes past 100-DMA
items.description: Jefferies, meanwhile, has issued a fresh note that sees 58% upside in ONGC, and has reiterated its buy call. The recent correction in the shares of ONGC seem to be overdone, said Jefferies.

items.title: ITC Ltd | Resilient performance amidst challenging operating environment
items.description: ITC is an Indian conglomerate with diverse business interests, spanning across Cigarettes, Branded Packaged Foods, Personal Care, hotels and Agri. ITC is well diversified players with Cigarette business being a cash cow which enables incubation of new high growth business. The recent quarterly earnings were in line expectations but inflationary pressure weighed on consumption and FMCG business. ITC also offers a decent dividend yield, which can help it outperform in the near term, given the macro headwinds and elevated market volatility. Moreover, post de-merger of the asset-heavy hotel business, the return profile of ITC is expected to improve substantially.

items.title: Bears tighten grip! Sensex falls 500 pts, Nifty below 24,100 amid volatility; banks, IT tumble; metals shine
items.description: In the afternoon, Nifty IT and Pharma sectors traded in the red, each falling around 1 percent, after strong gains in the previous session, where they had risen by 2 and 1 percent, respectively.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp slips over 3%, top Nifty loser on weak December sales data
items.description: Hero Moto's sales declined by 18 percent YoY to 3.24 lakh units in December 2024

items.title: Western Carriers stock zooms 13% after securing Rs 139-crore contract from Vedanta
items.description: The four year-long agreement involves the handling of import, finished goods (FG) domestic, and export materials at Vedanta's JSG Plant

items.title: Shiva Texyarn shares zoom 12% as firm secures major order from Indian Air Force
items.description: Indian Air Force has assigned an order valued at Rs 36.19 crore to Shiva Texyarn for supply of 16,000 pairs of NBC

items.title: Sensex plunges 700 pts, Nifty below 24,050 as selling pressure continues; banks, IT weigh
items.description: On the positive side, the Nifty Oil and Gas and Energy index rallied 1 percent each. Nifty PSU Bank index, which received robust buying interest in the morning, succumbed to selling pressure trad marginally in the green.

items.title: JM Financial gets Sebi administrative warning for non-compliance during Western Carrier IPO
items.description: Sebi's letter has raised concerns over the fact that the approval of the board and shareholders regarding increase in authorized share capital of Western Carrier was taken while the issue was already open for subscription.

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty snap 2-day bull run, end lower | Closing Bell
items.description: Sensex, Nifty fall post best session in 6 weeks. Sensex falls over 700 pts, Nifty down nearly 200 pts. Bank Nifty, Nifty IT indices top sectoral laggards. Oil & gas, media stocks buck market trend. Midcap, Smallcap indices outperform. Join Lovisha Darad in conversation with Ashish Bahety, Technical and Derivative Research Analyst

items.title: Taking Stock: Bears back in action; Nifty below 24,050, Sensex falls 700 pts
items.description: Among sectors, bank, capital goods, IT, pharma shed 1 percent each, while oil & gas, media rose 1 percent each

items.title: ITI shares hit 20% upper circuit amid high volumes to post biggest single-day gain in 9 months
items.description: ITI shares rose a whopping 70% since April 2024.

items.title: Defence player DCX Systems offers 49% upside, PL Capital bets orders set to rise
items.description: DCX Systems is expected to benefit from demand for items that were previously imported but are now made by Indian OEMs such as BEL, HAL, L&T and others.

items.title: Nishant Pitti says Easy Trip Planners share sale for 'personal reasons', no plan to sell further stake
items.description: Nishant Pitti has sold some of his stake in the company during 2024, and this week, he further pared 1.4% stake in Easy Trip Planners before stepping down as CEO of the company.

items.title: Marico beats slowdown blues with 'steady' rural demand, 'stable' urban sentiment in Q3FY25
items.description: Marico has posted a sequential uptick in volume growth, and the consolidated business has posted 'mid-teen revenue growth' compared to a year ago. The company said it is on track to meet double-digit growth for the full year.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on Jan 3, 2024
items.description: The markets reflected a mixed sectoral performance, wherein banking, capital goods, IT, and pharma shed 1% each. At the same time, oil & gas and media gained 1%.

items.title: Major exit at Kotak Mahindra Bank as COO and CTO Milind Nagnur steps down
items.description: The resignation dated January 3 informed that Nagnur's last day at the bank would be February 15, 2025. An interim structure has been put in place at the bank to ensure smooth functioning, said the company.
